channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15429] Add a split policy for busy regions
item.description:
Currently, all region split policies are based on size. However, in certain cases, it is a wise choice to make a split decision based on number of requests to the region and split busy regions.

A crude metric is that if a region blocks writes often and throws RegionTooBusyExceoption, it's probably a good idea to split it.
item.summary: Add a split policy for busy regions

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

comments.comment: V1: BusyRegionSplitPolicy that splits regions with a minimum age (online time) based on blocked request rate (numBlockedRequests / numWriteRequests) calculated over a moving window of 5 minutes.
My biggest comment is why put all of this in a the table descriptor and not in the config?
Elliott Clark It's in both places, consistent with MAX_FILE_SIZE, to allow for a table level control over the settings.

-1 overall

HBASE-15429-V1.patch:
Removed the properties from HTableDescriptor. Modified the defaults to be more aggressive and added a description for the BusyRegionSplitPolicy class.
